It's like every week we read about some young person losing their life so senselessly. I can't imagine the heartbreak their family and friends are going through and I hope I never have to. R.I.P. beautiful girl.

The scrap yards should be charged with receiving stolen property. IF the laws were ENFORCED, this wouldn't be in the news. As far as the scrap yards not knowing these are stolen...come on,how many spares do you carry around in your car or truck?

The issue is not WHO is running. The issue is are WE going to become and remain vigilant citizens who prioritize our politics and culture and rights, over television and instant gratification? It's up to us, why aren't you doing articles on voting and the lack there of, and the low numbers that turn out? Why aren't you doing stories on the need to be involved all the time, and to demand accountability from all elected officials?
Obama is not president now. Move on.

I don't think we're too concerned with each others' opinions. But I do think, and perhaps you'll agree, that judging from many of the comments here, that her concern for Peru was wasted. They voted in a corrupt, despotic scumbag and they would rather hate an American who sublet her apartment to the wrong crowd(according to them) than just admit that they elected an authoritarian asshole.
